page.title: 12GROUNDWORK AT THORNHAM
page.content: On the 20th. May, 1985 a group of pupils from Thornham St. James Primary School took part in a wildflower seed sowing ceremony, arranged by the Groundwork Trust, down Thornham Old Road. Groundwork Trust is an organisation that looks after the countryside. Many local people are worried about the way wild flowers are dying out. Wild flowers need protection because there are so many buildings covering the land and weedkillers are poisoning the plants. Thornham Old Road is a cartroad where there is not much traffic and the wide verges are not sprayed with weedkiller. It is a good place for sowing wildflower seeds. The flowers should grow well.
